reviewText: I nave the two movies on dvd and found them to be credible entertainment.  I am a stan neufeld andsigmund neufeld movie fan.  I have seen many of their best b movies.  The lippert movie productions was a small movie company specializing in b movies.  The sins of Jezebel for a b movie was done well and stayed close to the biblical narrative I think that this was either the only movie done on the biblical jezebel or the best of the few.Paulett goddard sold the movie well.  Queen of the amazons was b entertainment. well acted out by robert lowery,nigel bebruillier and the other team of actors it was an african adventure yarn and nothing more.  If you enjoy vintage films you will get your money's worth.  Sigmund neufeld with sam neufeld seemed to specialize in the billy the kid westerns, lone rider westerns, Lash larue and a few b crime movies but stepped up in the curse of Jezebel and delivers entertainment.
summary: the sins of jezebel and queen of the amazons
Title: N/A

reviewText: Whoever wrote the five star review for this pair of turkeys has to be working for or a shill for VCI. You see the same glowing praise from him for virtually  everything they release here. I'm both a big fan of VCI and B movies but this combo is really from the bottom of the barrel. Don't let the alluring color poster on the cover fool you, "SIns of Jezebel" is low budget stuff from Lippert and not very good low budget stuff at that! "Ten Commandments" it ain't! It ain't even "Princess of the Nile" (with Debra Paget)! It's a real yawner from start to finish but it is in not so glorious Ansco Color and anamorphic wide screen if that makes any difference.The second feature is "Queen of the Amazons" and even by B movie standards it's not very good either although at least I didn't have to fight falling asleep as I did with "Jezebel". An unbelievable amount of jungle stock footage combined with the great white hunter (Robert Lowry) leading a safari into danger story you've seen from Monogram and PRC a hundred times. The only difference here is that it's from Lippert. Best thing about it is that it only runs about 54 minutes...but it's still about 50 minutes too long. VCI says 8 minutes was cut from the initial running time, thank you for small favors. Cuthbert Twiddle (me) says "Skip it Bwana!"
summary: Forget That Other Five Star Review!

reviewText: Have yet to watch Queen of the Amazons. Sins of Jezebel was a reasonably accurate portrayal of the biblical story.

reviewText: VCI Entertainment and Kit Parker Films presents "MOVIE BAD GIRLS DOUBLE FEATURE" (Sins of Jezebel (1954) & Queen of the Amazons (1947) --- (Dolby digitally remastered)...featuring top performances from the '40s and '50s with outstanding drama and screenplays, along with a wonderful cast and supporting actors to bring it all together  ... another winner from the vaults of almost forgotten Hollywood gems.First up we have Lippert Pictures feature "SINS OF JEZEBEL" (1954) (74 min/Color) --- Under Reginald Le Borg  (Director),  Sigmund Neufeld  (Producer),  Richard Landau  (Screenwriter),  Gilbert Warrenton  (Cinematographer),  Bert Shefter  (Composer (Music Score), Carl Pierson  (Editor),  F. Paul Sylos  (Art Director), Paul F. Sylos  (Art Director) ----- the cast includes Paulette Goddard  (Jezebel), George Nader  (Jehuz),  John Hoyt  (Elijah),  Eduard Franz  (King Ahab),  John Shelton  (Loram), Margia Dean  (Deborah), Joe Besser  (Yonkel, Chariot man), Ludwig Donath  (Naboth), Carmen D'Antonio  (Dancer) . . . . . our film and story has a scheming wicked princess of Phoenicia named Jezebel whose pagan ways brings destruction to all she comes in contact with ... Paulette Goddard is believeable as Jezebel, with George Nader who is under her magical spell ... will she introduce her pagan idols in place of the God of Israel, what danger lies before the King of Israel Eduard Franz as Ahab ... Sins of Jezebel takes place in 9th Century, B.C., in the city of Jezreel, the prophet Elijah warns Ahab, the King of Israel, against marrying Jezebel the beautiful but evil Phoenician ... on a very small budget this film comes across and delivers the goods and moreBIOS:1.  Paulette Goddard  (aka:Marion Goddard Levy)Date of birth:  3 June 1910 - Whitestone Landing, Long Island, New YorkDate of death:  23 April 1990 - Ronco, Switzerland2.  George NaderDate of birth:  19 October 1921 - Pasadena, CaliforniaDate of death:  4 February 2002 - Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, California3.  Reginald Le Borg  (Director)Date of birth:  11 December 1902 - Vienna, Austria-Hungary (now Austria)Date of death:  25 March 1989 - Los Angeles, California4.  Robert L. Lippert (Producer)Date of birth: 31 March 1909 - Alameda, California, USADate of death: 16 November 1976 - Unknown City & StateBONUS FEATURES:1.  Movie Trivia2.  Photo Gallery3.  Three Nuts In Search of A Bolt (trailer)4.  Promises Promises (trailer)Second on the double bill is a Robert L. Lippert Picture release "QUEEN OF THE AMAZONS" (1947) (61 min/B/W) --- Under Edward F. Finney  -(Director / Producer), Roger Merton  (Screenwriter), Robert Pittack  (Cinematographer), Lee Zahler  (Musical Direction/Supervision), John Link  (Editor), James Reimer  (Art Director) ----- the cast includes Robert Lowery (Gary Lambert), Patricia Morison (Jean Preston), J. Edward Bromberg (Gabby), John Miljan (Narrator/Colonel Jones), Amira Moustafa (Zita, the Amazon Queen), Keith Richards (Wayne Monroe), Bruce Edwards (Greg Jones), Wilson Benge (Professor), Jack George (Commissioner), Cay Forrester (Sugi), Vida Aldana (Tondra), Hassan Khayyam (Moya) . . . . . our story line as woman searches the Amazon jungle for her missing fiancé ... The problem is not that she finds her husband alive and well, but that he has fallen in love with the Amazon Queen ... is the jungle controlled by a tribe of she-devils ... are outsiders safe, or will they be enslaved and tortured by a gang of smugglers ... what's with all the lions roaming the Lippert Picture set, does one of them have a collar ... don't leave the theater you're about to find out in the last reel . . . . . all courtesy of VCI Entertainment, who in my humble opinion is the best there is in restoring early serials and film noir features like this one.BIOS:1.  Robert LoweryDate of birth:  17 October 1913 - Kansas City, MissouriDate of death:  26 December 1971 - Hollywood, California,2.  Patricia MorrisonDate of birth:  19 March 1915 - New York, New YorkDate of death:  Still Living3.  Edward F Finney  (Director)Date of birth:  18 April 1903 - New York, New YorkDate of death:  10 January 1983 - Los Angeles, CaliforniaBONUS FEATURES:1.  Movie Trivia2.  Photo Gallery3.  Bad Blonde (trailer)4.  Man Bait (trailer)5.  Unwed Mother (trailer)Great job by VCI Entertainment for releasing the "MOVIE BAD GIRLS DOUBLE FEATURE" (Sins of Jezebel (1954) & Queen of the Amazons (1947), digital transfere with a clean, clear and crisp print...looking forward to more of the same from the '40s and '50s vintage...order your copy now from Amazon or VCI Entertainment, stay tuned once again for epics and jungle adventures that only VCI Entertainment (King of the Serials) can deliver.Total Time: 128 mins on DVD ~ VCI Home Video KPF-559 ~ (9/26/2006)
summary: "Epics & Jungle Adventure ... Sins of Jezebel (1954) & Queen of the Amazons (1947) ... VCI Home Video"

reviewText: I'm just OK with VCI's DVD presentation.  Overall, Sins of Jezebel looks good enough, but there are short picture fluctuations throughout the film(transfer issues or just plain sloppiness or VHS?), and at least 2 pops that interrupted dialogue.  Queen of the Amazons appears to be a British print.  It fares better than the former in that the print itself doesn't have any viewing issues.  VCI says this is the shortened version missing 8 minutes and that the longer version is the one generally on TV.  If so, where is the longer version?  Why is it not on this DVD?  Most often, VCI and others that put out DVD's don't explain important issues such as these.  C'mon, DVD producers, let us know what we are getting in advance, and the reason why.  Then, I might not be so critical!
Title: N/A

reviewText: SINS OF JEZEBEL(1953) Directed by Reginald Le Borg.Based on THE BIBLE by God. Additional dialogue by Richard Landau. Produced by Robert Lippert and Sigmund Neufeld.Starring Paulette Goddard(as Jezebel), George Nader(as Jehu), Eduard Franz(as Ahab) Ludwig Donath(as Naboth), Joe Besser and John Hoyt as the narrator and Elijah.After the death of Solomon, Israel splintered into two kingdoms--the Kingdom of Judah--basically Jerusalem and the surrounding area in the South and the Northern Kingdom of Samaria. Several years later Samaria is ruled by the powerful but very flawed when it comes to women Ahab. Marrying the pagan princess Jezebel, he is quickly henpecked and accedes to her demands that Samaria begin worshiping Baal. Eventually she demands that the Jews who remain faithful to the Lord be persecuted and eventually exterminated. Finally, due to the continual opposition by the prophet Elijah and finally army captain Jehu, the people, upon Ahab's death in combat, rise up to drive the pagans from their midst and destroy the wicked Jezebel.After Saul, David and Solomon, the most important Hebrew King whose coverage is the most extensive in detail(most just get a few paragraphs) was Ahab and his wicked queen Jezebel. As such, it is surprising that they have not been a continual film subject but, unless there is another film out there that this viewer is unaware of, this represents the only reasonabely serious attempt.Unfortunately this is The Bible by way of Monogram and PRC. A film that can best be desribed by the following hypothetical conversation.Hey why dont we make a movie about Ahab and Jezebel?Brilliant!! We can get Joe Besser who played Stinky on the Abbott and Costello TV show.This exhausting buffetting of good idea immediately followed by a very bad one is what finally sinks the film. Every time the film has a nice bit of visual cleverness or makes effective use of the Biblical material, it is immediately followed by some terrible artistic mistake. So we get a film that is actually fairly well versed in its source material and even makes references to Solomon and Sheba and other, to date, unfilmed Biblical figures but then we are confronted with its cast of thirty bored looking extras or stock footage from Universals ALI BABA AND THE FORTY THIEVES or Joe Besser. The film.s idea of a vile pagan rite is a ballerina with a big nose flailing about like some bad Vegas show---(which causes Nader's Jehu, disturbed by such SIN, to leave the room using his single expression(frown).To give a further example of how schizophrenic the film is quality wise. In The Bible, Jehu leads his forces to the walls of Samaria. There on the high walls, he is confronted by an insulting Jezebel. Jehu orders her to thrown from the walls and Jezebel goes splat. Later on Jehu regrets leaving a queen,s corpse lying around and orders her to be buried but too late as the dogs have devoured her corpse. Great stuff. Idiot proof. In the film, Jezebel goes out on the wall and is killed by an arrow.(Huh??) Jehu, regreting her death, orders her to be buried(Good) but his soldiers toss her corpse off the wall instead(So far so good). Jehu looks down at her corpse but instead of her body being devoured by dogs, a chariot drives over her head(Huh??)The cast is strictly scrubs. Nader demonstrates forcibly that his career was not destroyed because he was a homosexual but because he had one...count em ONE expression and the charisma of a tree trunk. Goddard--a very limmited actress who could be effective in very specific roles---is not the gorgeous siren of Evil that is required here and the script insists endlessly that she is but is more of a grating voiced big boned fishwife. The rest of the cast is nothing special. Besser has no business being in the film. Hoyt---whose film this really is with his two roles--is not this viewer's idea of the prophet Elijah, being more stodgy rather than being somewhat frightening(think Micheal York as John the baptist in JESUS OF NAZARETH). When he should be shrieking and spitting at Ahab, he tends to recite and intone.The great pity is that if Universal had done this, we could have had an entertaining film starring perhaps Rex Reason(as Jehu), Jeff Morrow(as Ahab) and Faith Domerque(as Jezebel). If MGM or Warners had done this, it would have been a film remembered from the decade as being a superb example of the 50s Biblical epic. And if Cecil B DeMille had done this---with perhaps Hedy Lamar as Jezebel--we would have had something spectacular.But instead we have this. Not truly bad but not terribly good either. A remake by anyone with even the slightest talent could probably top this with ease and is desirable but will probably never happen. So this is it.
summary: Yeah! Bible Epic! Yeah! Joe Besser! That is the ticket!!
Title: N/A
